summary: The Navy took a revolutionary, dual ship approach to buying the Littoral Combat Ship over a decade ago, but this approach has fallen short. LCS has taken longer, cost more, and delivered less capability than expected. The Navy recently decided to pursue a modified LCS that it calls a frigate. The Navy intends to commit quickly and buy 12 frigates, but the ship's design, cost...
title: Littoral Combat Ship and Frigate: Slowing Planned Frigate Acquisition Would Enable Better-Informed Decisions
